SENT.plain: INTRODUCTION: Transient global amnesia (TGA) is one of the most striking syndromes in clinical neurology
Brain lesions producing TGA have been reported in the hippocampus, amygdala, thalamus, caudate nucleus, and neocortex
CASE REPORT: We report a 63-year-old woman presenting with TGA associated with a localized lesion in the left putamen
CONCLUSIONS: This case suggests a potential role of the putamen in human memory processing
